description: Secure RAG platform - Updated with FORGE, 5-Tier Security, Mercury Reasoning Display

decisions.auto_promotion: Drop Zone → Tier 1 automatic after successful ingestion
decisions.template_ocr: DeepSeek-OCR via Vertex AI MaaS (superior layout understanding)

epics.name: GCP Migration
epics.description: Migrate existing codebase to GCP infrastructure

epics.name: Document Pipeline
epics.description: Real file processing with Document AI and Cloud Storage

epics.name: RAG Engine
epics.description: Migrate LLM to Vertex AI, implement full RAG pipeline with AlloyDB

epics.name: 5-Tier Security Architecture
epics.description: Implement 5-tier document security model (Drop Zone → Tier 1 → Tier 2 → Locked Vault → Fort Knox)

epics.name: Mercury Reasoning Display
epics.description: Expose AI reasoning process with collapsible steps and confidence scoring

epics.name: Drop Zone File Explorer
epics.description: Replace O365/Windows file management paradigm with RAGbox-native approach

epics.name: FORGE Template System
epics.description: Learn user templates via DeepSeek-OCR and generate branded documents

epics.name: Settings UI
epics.description: GitHub-style settings page with security overview pattern

stories.title: Audit Existing Codebase and Create Migration Plan
Set Up GCP Project and Enable APIs
Migrate LLM from OpenRouter to Vertex AI
Implement Full RAG Pipeline with Citations
Update Vault to Show Real Documents
Define 5-Tier Security Data Model
stories.description: As a system architect, I want the database schema to support 5 security tiers so that documents can be properly classified and access-controlled.
acceptance_criteria: Document table includes `security_tier` field (enum: 0-4)
Tier 0 (Drop Zone): staging flag, 24hr TTL, not queryable
Tier 1 (Working): standard encryption, folder hierarchy supported
Tier 2 (Sensitive): enhanced audit logging, folder hierarchy supported
Tier 3 (Locked Vault): no folder hierarchy, restricted access
Tier 4 (Fort Knox): privilege toggle visibility, full audit trail
Migration script updates existing documents to Tier 1 by default
Schema enforces tier-specific constraints

stories.title: Implement Drop Zone Auto-Promotion
stories.description: As a user, I want files to automatically promote from Drop Zone (Tier 0) to Working (Tier 1) after successful ingestion so that I don't have to manually promote every file.
acceptance_criteria: Files uploaded to Drop Zone have security_tier = 0
After successful Document AI extraction AND embedding generation, tier auto-updates to 1
Auto-promotion triggers audit log entry
Files stuck in Drop Zone > 24 hours are auto-purged with audit record
Failed ingestion keeps file in Tier 0 with error status
UI shows ingestion progress with tier promotion indicator

stories.title: Implement Tier Promotion UI Flow
stories.description: As a user, I want to manually promote documents between security tiers with appropriate confirmation dialogs so that I maintain control over document sensitivity.
acceptance_criteria: Right-click context menu shows 'Promote to [next tier]' option
Tier 1 → Tier 2: Confirmation dialog with sensitivity warning
Tier 2 → Tier 3: Confirmation dialog + reason required
Tier 3 → Tier 4: Partner approval workflow (if not Partner role)
Demotion from Tier 4 is blocked (one-way promotion)
Demotion from Tier 3 requires Partner approval
Each promotion creates audit record with reason
UI immediately updates tier badge after promotion

stories.title: Implement Tier-Based Query Filtering
stories.description: As a user, I want my queries to respect security tiers so that I only see results from documents I have access to.
acceptance_criteria: Tier 0 documents are never included in query results
Tier 1-2 documents always included for authorized users
Tier 3 documents only included if user has explicit access
Tier 4 documents only included when Privilege Toggle is ON
Query results include tier badge for each citation
Retrieval pipeline filters by tier BEFORE vector search
Audit log records which tiers were searched

stories.title: Implement Tier Visual Indicators
stories.description: As a user, I want clear visual indicators of document security tiers so that I can immediately understand the sensitivity of each file.
acceptance_criteria: Tier 0: Pulsing cyan dashed border (staging)
Tier 1: White folder icon with blue file badge
Tier 2: Amber lock icon with warning border
Tier 3: Red shield icon
Tier 4: Red shield with glow pulse when Privilege Toggle ON
List view shows tier badge column
Grid view shows tier overlay on thumbnail
Consistent icons across Vault, Mercury citations, and hover modals

stories.title: Implement Mercury Reasoning Panel Structure
stories.description: As a user, I want to see how Mercury arrived at its answer so that I can trust and verify the response.
acceptance_criteria: Every Mercury response includes collapsible reasoning panel
Collapsed state shows: '▸ N steps | Confidence: XX%'
Expanded state shows 5 steps: Query Analysis, Document Retrieval, Source Analysis, Confidence Scoring, Response Generation
Each step has timestamp and brief description
Animation: 200ms ease for expand/collapse
Panel uses JetBrains Mono for step details
Panel respects Cyber-Noir styling (OLED black background)

stories.title: Implement Reasoning Data Collection
stories.description: As a developer, I want the RAG pipeline to emit structured reasoning data so that Mercury can display the thought process.
acceptance_criteria: RAG pipeline returns ReasoningTrace object with each response
ReasoningTrace includes: query_interpretation, retrieval_stats, source_agreement, confidence_breakdown, generation_context
retrieval_stats: documents_searched, chunks_retrieved, top_k used
source_agreement: agreement_score, contradictions_found
confidence_breakdown: retrieval_coverage (0.4), source_agreement (0.4), model_certainty (0.2)
Trace data stored in audit log for debugging
API response includes reasoning in structured JSON

stories.title: Implement Enhanced Citation Display
stories.description: As a user, I want citations to be interactive and highlight sources so that I can verify answers.
acceptance_criteria: Citations display as numbered blue pills: [1] [2] [3]
Hover on citation: highlights source in right pane (200ms ease)
Click on citation: scrolls to and spotlights exact passage
Spotlighted text glows electric cyan (#00F0FF)
Citation tooltip shows: filename, page number, relevance score
Multiple citations to same document are grouped
Right pane shows full source context around citation

stories.title: Implement Confidence Badge with Silence Protocol
stories.description: As a user, I want clear confidence indicators so that I know when to trust the answer.
acceptance_criteria: Confidence ≥ 85%: White badge on cyan background, full answer displayed
Confidence < 85%: Amber badge, Silence Protocol triggered
Silence Protocol message: 'I cannot provide a confident answer based on your documents. Consider rephrasing or uploading additional materials.'
Silence Protocol response styled with amber border
Lock sound plays on Silence Protocol activation
Reasoning panel shows confidence breakdown even on refusal
Audit log records Silence Protocol trigger with confidence score

stories.title: Implement Drop Zone Left Sidebar
stories.description: As a user, I want a folder tree sidebar so that I can navigate my documents like a file explorer.
acceptance_criteria: Left sidebar (240px) shows folder tree hierarchy
Folders expandable/collapsible with chevron icons
Each folder shows security tier indicator (color-coded)
Quick access sections: Recent (last 10), Favorites (starred), Shared
Folders draggable for reorganization (Tier 1 & 2 only)
Storage usage indicator at bottom (used/total with progress bar)
Tier 3 & 4 show as flat lists (no folder hierarchy)
Search field at top filters folder tree

stories.title: Implement Drop Zone Main Content Area
stories.description: As a user, I want a main content area with list and grid views so that I can browse my documents efficiently.
acceptance_criteria: Recommended section: Thumbnail previews of frequently accessed + recently opened
List view: Name, Type icon, Security Tier, Date Modified, Activity (sortable)
Grid view: Thumbnail cards with file previews
Toggle between List/Grid view with persistent preference
Multi-select with shift-click and cmd/ctrl-click
Right-click context menu: Open, Query, Promote, Move, Delete
Drag-and-drop upload always active (pulsing cyan dashed border when empty)
Empty state: 'Feed the Box' with upload instructions

stories.title: Implement File Hover Modal
stories.description: As a user, I want detailed file information on hover so that I can preview documents without opening them.
acceptance_criteria: Modal appears after 500ms hover delay
Shows: Document preview thumbnail (first page)
Shows: Filename, type, size, page count
Shows: Security tier badge (color-coded)
Shows: Upload date, last modified, last queried
Shows: Audit status indicator (checkmark if logged)
Quick actions bar: Open, Query, Promote, Delete
Modal positioned to not overflow viewport
Modal dismisses on mouse leave with 200ms delay

stories.title: Implement DeepSeek-OCR Integration
stories.description: As a developer, I want to integrate DeepSeek-OCR via Vertex AI MaaS so that FORGE can analyze template layouts.
acceptance_criteria: DeepSeek-OCR client initialized via Vertex AI endpoint
Can process PDF, DOCX (converted to images), and image templates
Returns structured output: text blocks, bounding boxes, layout hierarchy
Identifies: headers/footers, fonts/sizes, logo placement, section structure
Handles multi-page documents
Error handling for unsupported formats
Rate limiting and retry logic for API calls
Results cached in Cloud Storage to avoid re-processing

stories.title: Implement Template Upload and Analysis Flow
stories.description: As a user, I want to upload a sample document and have FORGE learn my template so that future documents match my branding.
acceptance_criteria: Template upload UI in Settings > Templates section
Accepts: PDF, DOCX, DOC files
Processing indicator: 'Analyzing template...' with terminal-style log
DeepSeek-OCR extracts: header/footer patterns, font families/sizes/colors, logo placement, section structure, spacing/margins
After analysis, shows preview of extracted template for approval
User can name template and set as default
Templates saved to user's template library
Maximum 10 templates per user (MVP limit)

stories.title: Implement Template Library UI
stories.description: As a user, I want to manage my saved templates so that I can select the right one for each document.
acceptance_criteria: Template library grid in Settings > Templates
Each template card shows: name, preview thumbnail, created date, usage count
Star icon to mark default template
Edit button to rename template
Delete button with confirmation dialog
Default RAGbox template always available (cannot be deleted)
Templates sorted by: Most Used, Recently Created, Name
Empty state: 'No custom templates. Upload a sample document to create one.'

stories.title: Implement FORGE Document Generation
stories.description: As a user, I want to generate branded documents from Mercury responses so that I can share professional outputs.
acceptance_criteria: 'Forge Document' button appears on every Mercury response
Clicking opens template selector modal
Template selector shows: user templates + default RAGbox template
After selection, generates DOCX with content formatted to template
Generated document includes: content, citations, metadata footer, RAGbox audit watermark
Export formats: DOCX (primary), PDF (secondary)
Generated document available for download immediately
Document also saved to Tier 1 by default (user can promote)
Generation triggers audit log entry

stories.title: Implement Settings Page Layout
stories.description: As a user, I want a clean settings page so that I can configure my RAGbox experience.
acceptance_criteria: Settings page at /dashboard/settings
Left sidebar navigation with categories
Main content area shows selected category
Categories: Profile, Security, Vault, Templates, Notifications, Audit & Compliance, Integrations, Data Export
Each setting item shows: Title, Status Badge (Enabled/Disabled), Description, Action Button
Consistent with Cyber-Noir styling
Responsive: sidebar collapses on mobile

stories.title: Implement Security Settings Section
stories.description: As a user, I want to manage my security settings so that I can control access and authentication.
acceptance_criteria: Two-factor authentication toggle with setup flow
Active sessions list with 'Sign out all' button
API keys management (create, revoke, copy)
Privilege toggle default setting (start ON or OFF)
Password change form (current + new + confirm)
Each setting shows status badge (Enabled/Disabled)
Security actions trigger audit log entries

stories.title: Implement Vault Settings Section
stories.description: As a user, I want to manage my vault settings so that I can control storage and retention.
acceptance_criteria: Storage usage display: used/total with visual progress bar
Retention policy settings (default 7 years, configurable)
Auto-tier rules: configure auto-promotion criteria
Backup settings: enable/disable automatic backups
Danger zone: 'Delete all documents' with confirmation
Storage alerts: configure warning thresholds (80%, 90%)

stories.title: Implement Data Export Section
stories.description: As a user, I want to export all my data so that I'm not locked into RAGbox.
acceptance_criteria: One-click full export button
Export includes: all documents, metadata, query history, templates
Export format: ZIP with folder structure
Documents in original format, metadata in JSON
Selective export: choose specific folders/tiers
Download link generated (signed URL, 24hr expiry)
Export progress indicator for large vaults
Export action logged to audit trail
